text: hi everyone wuthenywutano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new frontier
record oxidized this is the newest and
third full-length lp from this uk
extreme metal act i've been slightly in
awe of their stuff ever since i heard
their music back in 2018 off that
unloved record which i didn't exactly
walk away from that record wanting more
per se but i still was pretty impressed
by how blistering and relentless the
music on this thing was essentially what
frontier brings to the table is this
brutally chaotic metal core with very
mathematic and jarring grooves many of
which are being pounded out with these
hulking gigantic
style guitars but in my opinion even
though this record was blaring i didn't
exactly find it to be daring i certainly
see frontiers uncompromising intensity
and how they push it to a point that's
kind of unique at least until some other
group comes along and does it faster and
louder and noisier and while unloved
trackless did have some sonic bells and
whistles and melodic flourishes here and
there still it wasn't really dynamic in
its approach to songwriting or sound for
the most part i find frontiers dizzying
performances and oppressive guitar tones
to be almost like an excuse not to
engage with a groove or a riff or a
melody that might actually stick in your
head for a few seconds now i wouldn't
dare cast this record off as just being
simply noisy because being so abrasive
is obviously a part of the group's
intent but again a lot of artists i'm
fond of in that lane just show a greater
appreciation for the dynamics of sound
and timbre of noise for one gent style
guitar tones not just on this record but
in general in my opinion are some of the
most unimaginative on the metal frontier
today and in the case of frontier they
don't really leave a lot of room for
anything else maybe again a bit of a
beat or some feedback or a crazy short
guitar look here and there but for the
most part these add-ons feel kind of
like i don't know hearing the band put
icing on a cinder block and telling me
it's a cupcake the vocals for the most
part aren't really anything that you
couldn't already get on like an every
time i die record or on any number of
albums from all the groups that have
sprung up in their wake but with having
said all that i still went into this new
lp with uh pretty high hopes because a
lot of fans and viewers were excitedly
telling me that this was a
groundbreaking lp there's more sound
play more electronics it's glitchier and
yeah going through oxidized i guess i do
hear like some more skips and synths
than i did on the previous record but is
this not the same exact abandoned
concept another time around i mean i'm
sorry but considering how much i
listened to unloved when it came out i
don't really see oxidized as like a
revelation we have the same basic
metalcore vocals the same mix
demolishing guitars the same
disorienting and unruly performance
style and don't get me wrong i think
there's merit to all of these things the
band is still at a relatively unmatched
point of extremity i'd say also in
comparison with unloved i think this
record is slightly better mixed too yeah
it is pummeling but i think the group
does a great job of making slightly more
room for these extra bits of you know
glitch and electronics and synths and
everything else but in my opinion a few
more abrasive layers and some extra
electronics does not an avant mathcore
masterpiece make there are some points
where these added sounds in my opinion
almost come off gimmicky like the
stuttering shots of whooping and
swooping tones that open up opaque
horizon they're so absurd and so loud it
almost kind of takes the edge off of the
thunderous guitars and drums underneath
now granted it is something i think this
moment on the record along with many
others provides more to listen to and
more to take in sonically which
ultimately kept oxidized from being mind
numbing to me halfway through in the way
that i found unloved to be when i was
listening to it and some of these sonic
additions led to some serious highlights
on the lp like the two note whaling
leads that paint much of the damage and
the sift they're really bold i feel like
i'm listening to a clash between some
really extreme metal core and
a siren going off because of some sort
of mechanical failure or a nuclear
meltdown i get a similar vibe off of the
screaming tones that are featured on
southern hemorrhage then there's the
crossover with noise corvettes will
haven which adds quite a bit of extra
color to the song this magnetic drift
also having them on the lp i think
speaks a lot to frontier's artistic
intentions and their creative roots as
does having a crossover with the band
ion dissonance just five tracks later
with lkwx there's this ominous
atmospheric passage of guitar in the
middle of the song that i think is
actually a highlight even if it is super
low key because it does bring in this
element of
tension building and space to breathe so
when those riffs and drums come
barreling back in you really feel it and
you know that's the thing about this lp
and frontier in general there's a lot of
noise there's a lot of intensity there
is a lot of frantic playing but by that
same token there's not a whole lot of
appreciation for progression or tension
and release and i wish the band could
explore things like contrast just a bit
more it would only make the intense
moments feel that much more intense all
of the abrasive tinny and melting tones
strewn about the song motherboard were
certainly a highlight and made that
track kind of mind blowing and day dark
is one of the few songs on the lp where
the band plays a relatively
straightforward groove and riff-wise and
the track in my opinion is so much more
visceral for it not only that but there
is another one of these kind of
atmospheric ominous beat oriented
midpoints where you do get a second to
breathe before the band comes back in
and just like crushes your skull in the
melodic progression as well at the end
of the song hope does give the record
kind of a bittersweet note to end on and
while this extra helping of creative
nuance for this record is greatly
appreciated i still think oxidized as an
album overall still offers too little
outside of just being
the most vicious sonic beating i've
received in 2021 and it's most
definitely that and if that's all the
band wanted to achieve then
mission accomplished if that's all that
you're looking for in a record you're
gonna love the out of this still i
think the writing on this lp leaves a
lot to be desired the band's approach to
vocals and guitar could be more
interesting and their core musical
ambitions could certainly be pushed
further i'm feeling a strong six on this
lp transition have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
it's another video you can check out hit
that up or the link to subscribe to the
channel anthony fantano frontierer
forever
